title: How to Disable or Enable Autoplay on Spotify

steps.title: Launch the “Spotify” app on your device.
steps.content: Launch the “Spotify” app on your device. Tap the Spotify app icon, which resembles three black, horizontal bars on a green background. Log into your account.

steps.title: Open the “Settings”.
steps.content: Open the “Settings”. Navigate to the Home tab and tap on the Settings icon (gear icon), in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Locate the Autoplay title.
steps.content: Locate the Autoplay title. You will see it in the “Playback” section.

steps.title: Enable or disable the feature.
steps.content: Enable or disable the feature. Toggle the green switch right after the “Autoplay” option to turn off the autoplay feature. Tap one more time to re-enable it. That's it!

steps.title: Open the “Spotify” app on your computer.
steps.content: Open the “Spotify” app on your computer. It's a green icon with three black, horizontal bars. Also, sign in to your account, if you haven't already done so.

steps.title: Click on the V icon, at the top-right side of the app.
steps.content: Click on the V icon, at the top-right side of the app. A drop-down menu will show up.

steps.title: Choose Settings from the list.
steps.content: Choose Settings from the list. This will open the Settings page.

steps.title: Scroll down to the “Autoplay” section.
steps.content: Scroll down to the “Autoplay” section. Click on the green switch under the Autoplay header to disable the feature. If you want to enable it, just switch the grey button to green again. That's it!
